subject: Economics
title: The Paradox of Thrift: When Saving Kills the Economy
description: One-minute skill: The Paradox of Thrift: When Saving Kills the Economy.

hook.text: Saving money is smart for you. But if everyone saves at once, the economy collapses.

buildup.text: When people fear recession, they cut spending and save more. But one person's spending is another's income.

discovery.text: If everyone saves simultaneously, total demand drops, businesses close, jobs disappear, and incomes fall.

twist.text: Japan experienced exactly this for 30 years. High savings, low spending, deflation, stagnation.

climax.text: The paradox of thrift shows that what's rational for one person can be catastrophic when everyone does it.

punchline.text: When everyone saves for a rainy day, it starts raining.

quiz.question: What is the paradox of thrift?
options: When everyone saves simultaneously, reduced spending causes economic decline that lowers total savings
